title: If the number of electrons in an atom is 8, and number of protons is also 8, what is the atomic number of the atom, and what is the charge on the atom? - Quora

response.answer_text: The number of protons is the atomic number. Therefore the element is Carbon. The proton being positively charged and the electrons being negatively charged makes this a neutral charge since 8+ + 8- = 0. The number of electrons can change by sharing with other atoms, or in mostly ionic bonds, being given away, or receiving extra. Give away electrons results in a net positively charged ION. Extra electrons result in a net negatively charged ION. (Only net neutrally charged particles are atoms.) If you change the number of protons, you no longer have the same element.
